newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: ANZ appoints new securities sales chief.
newsitem.headline: ANZ appoints new securities sales chief.

text.p: ANZ Investment Bank said its has appointed Wayne Crispe as head of securities sales Australia in a move to strengthen its global capital markets activities.

Crispe, who joined ANZ in July 1995 from Chase Manhattan Bank, would be responsible for the full range of securities sales across the yield curve from vanilla to highly structured and including all debt instruments, debt/equity and emerging markets products.
Grahame Miller, General Manager Financial markets said the appointment reflected ANZIB's commitment to building the market for non-sovereign and emerging markets debt products in Australia.
This included building a comprehensive securities distribution capacity in support of ANZIB's global capital markets trading, origination and research capabilities.
